page.title: 07The Hut Ripple
page.content: Lying four miles north of Tewkesbury on A38. Convenient to M50, offering breakfast and lunches to about 1000 lorry drivers a week. Recently rebuilt by family who run it. Owner builder pigeon fancier. Well known as a good refreshment stop attracting many tourists in Summer when commercial users decrease. Busiest time possibly winter months when more substantial fayre is consumed. The cafe is open from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. each weekdays and 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. Saturday. Ample parking space being sited between two lay-bys.
